moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bd3: an odd move for a weaker player, Bc4 being the main line, this move weakens his position and eventually leads to terrible consequences
moves.9. Nd5: ! attacks the queen, threatens Nxc7  fork, also threatens Qxg7 winning the rook if Qd8
moves.9... Qg6: the lesser of all the evils, loses the rook, but takes his knight out of the game
moves.12. hxg4 Nf6 13. g5 Nh5 14. Bc4: terrible move, allows my knights to run wild
moves.14... Nxc2: pins the pawn on f2 to his king
moves.15... Ng3: he can't take because of the bishop pin
moves.16. Rd1: again a forced rook move and his king is in trouble
moves.16... h6: the ultimate poisoned pawn, if he takes Rxh6 checkmate on the h file is forced
moves.18. d3: weak attack because all of his other pieces are immobilised and his king is completely helpless
moves.18... Rh1#: even down a full rook, an open file can still dominate
